title: SpaceX rapidly constructing Starship’s first Florida launch pad and tower
summary: After restarting work on the project a few months ago, SpaceX appears to have gotten back up to speed and begun to...

title: Satellites to test-fly new cyber software
summary: As space systems face growing cyberattacks, the Aerospace Corp. and TriSept Corp. are preparing separate flight tests of software to alert satellite operators of anomalies detected onboard.

title: NASA restarts moon rocket wet dress rehearsal countdown
summary: NASA restarted a two-day dress-rehearsal countdown Tuesday for the agency’s new Space Launch System moon rocket after a series of unrelated glitches, mostly involving ground systems, blocked two earlier attempts to fully fuel the huge launcher to verify its readiness for flight.

title: GAO completes investigation of the decision to relocate U.S. Space Command
summary: Colorado lawmakers announced April 12 that they have been briefed by the Government Accountability Office on the agency’s investigation of the January 2021 decision to relocate U.S. Space Command headquarters from Colorado Springs to Huntsville, Alabama.

title: Astranis adds extra year of life to small GEO satellite design
summary: Improvements Astranis has made to the propulsion systems of four small satellites slated to launch in 2023 will add at least another year to their operational lives, according to CEO John Gedmark.

title: Defense Intelligence Agency calls attention to China’s and Russia’s growing presence in space
summary: A new report by the Defense Intelligence Agency notes that the space fleets of China and Russia grew more than 70% in just over two years.

title: NASA, UAE Mars Missions Agree to Share Science Data
summary: NASA’s MAVEN mission and the United Arab Emirates’ Hope Probe mission are paving the way toward greater scientific collaboration and data exchange between the two Mars orbiters.

title: NASA to restart fueling test of SLS rocket, with key modifications
summary: "We’re very comfortable with the path forward."

title: US, India agree to cooperate on space situational awareness
summary: The United States and India have agreed to cooperate on space situational awareness, a deal that the U.S. Department of Defense said would “lay the groundwork for more advanced cooperation in space.”

title: Astra wins order for electric thrusters from LeoStella
summary: Astra Space announced April 12 an order of electric thrusters by LeoStella, part of the company’s efforts to move beyond launch.
